_comment: TEMPLATE: Search Configuration - Copy this file and rename it to '[viewname]-search.json'
_description: Configure the global search functionality for the table, including regex support, result highlighting, and search history.
_usage: Enable search features appropriate for your use case. All features are optional.

_options.enabled: true/false - Enable/disable the global search feature entirely

_highlightOptions.highlightResults: true/false - Visually highlight search terms in table cells (yellow background)

_regexOptions.enableRegex: true/false - Allow users to search using regular expressions (adds regex toggle button)

_historyOptions.showSearchHistory: true/false - Save and show dropdown of previous searches
_historyOptions.maxHistoryItems: Number (5-50) - Maximum recent searches to keep in history
_historyOptions.storage: Search history is stored in browser localStorage

_advancedOptions.smartSearch: true/false - Enable intelligent search matching (partial words, fuzzy matching)
_advancedOptions.searchDelay: Number (milliseconds) - Delay before search executes while user types (default: 400ms)

_searchBehavior.globalSearch: Searches across all searchable columns simultaneously
_searchBehavior.liveSearch: Results update as user types (with delay)
_searchBehavior.clearButton: X button appears to clear search when text is entered
_searchBehavior.keyboardShortcut: Ctrl+F or / to focus search box (if keyboard navigation enabled)
_searchBehavior.placeholder: Configurable placeholder text in search input

_bestPractices: Always enable highlightResults - it greatly improves user experience
Enable regex for power users working with technical data
Keep maxHistoryItems between 10-30 for good balance
Set searchDelay to 300-500ms to balance responsiveness and performance
Disable regex if users are non-technical or don't need advanced patterns
Enable search history for tables users search frequently
Test regex patterns to ensure they work as expected
Provide regex help/examples if enabling regex feature
Consider disabling search for very small tables (< 20 rows)
Ensure searchable columns are properly configured in columns config

_performance.smallTables: Search is instant on tables with < 1,000 rows
_performance.largeTables: May experience lag on tables with > 10,000 rows
_performance.searchDelay: Prevents excessive searches while user is still typing
_performance.highlighting: May slow down rendering on very large result sets
_performance.optimization: Set searchable:false on columns that don't need searching (improves performance)

_userInterface.clearButton: X icon appears in search box when text entered
_userInterface.regexToggle: Button to enable/disable regex mode (if enableRegex=true)
_userInterface.resultCount: Shows 'Showing X of Y entries' below table
_userInterface.noResults: Shows 'No matching records found' when search returns nothing

_accessibility.label: Search input has proper ARIA label (from aria config)
_accessibility.liveRegion: Search results announced to screen readers
_accessibility.clearButton: Clear button has ARIA label and keyboard support
_accessibility.shortcuts: Keyboard shortcuts work with screen readers

_integration.filters: Search works together with column filters (both apply simultaneously)
_integration.columns: Only searches columns where searchable:true in columns config
_integration.serverSide: For server-side processing, search query sent to backend
_integration.selection: Row selection works with search results

_troubleshooting.noResults: Check that columns have searchable:true in columns config
_troubleshooting.regexError: Provide user feedback for invalid regex patterns
_troubleshooting.highlightNotWorking: Ensure render functions preserve highlight markup

_whenToDisable: Table has fewer than 10-15 rows (not needed)
All data visible on one page
Users use filters instead of search
Table is view-only with minimal interaction
_whenToEnable: Users need to find specific records quickly
Data analysis or exploration use cases
Power users who benefit from regex patterns
